headline: Q&A: Asset-Backed Debt Was Linked to the Credit Crisis. Why Is It Popular Again?
summary: Matt Wirz and Justin Baer wrote about how things turned around for the structured credit industry.  Bigger even than the boom years of 2006 and 2007, when mortgage bonds were selling like crazy before they brought the global financial system to the brink.  Financiers are once again creating and selling securities backed by everything—the more creative the better—such as corporate loans and consumer credit-card debt; lease payments on cars, airplanes and golf carts; and payments to data centers.

headline: Greenhaven Road Capital Main Fund Q4 2024 Investor Letter
summary: The Greenhaven Road Capital Main Fund returned ~13% during the quarter and ended up more than 27% for the full year. Click here to read the full commentary.
